reference: Volume Seven, Issue Forty-Eight, File 5 of 18
title: Phrack Prophile
historical_context: This article marks a transition in Phrack's editorial team, introducing new editors who are prominent figures in the hacker community.
target_audience: Hackers, security enthusiasts, and those interested in hacker culture.
short_summary: This article introduces the new editorial team of Phrack, featuring profiles of Daemon9, ReDragon, and Voyager. Each profile shares personal histories, motivations for hacking, and their vision for the future of Phrack.
summary: In this special edition of Phrack, the new editorial team—Daemon9, ReDragon, and Voyager—introduces themselves through personal anecdotes and reflections on their journeys into hacking. Daemon9 recounts his early days with computers, emphasizing a relentless pursuit of knowledge and a disdain for superficial understanding. He highlights his experiences with various operating systems and his role in the hacker community, particularly through the Information Nexus. ReDragon shares his evolution from a curious child with a Hayes modem to a seasoned hacker, expressing gratitude for the community that shaped his skills. He emphasizes the importance of giving back to the next generation of hackers. Voyager's profile details his transition from a college student to an influential figure in the hacking scene, illustrating his commitment to fostering a knowledgeable community through initiatives like the #hack FAQ. Together, these profiles encapsulate the spirit of Phrack and its dedication to quality content and community engagement.
